skill.name: agile-product-owner
skill.description: Agile product ownership toolkit for Senior Product Owner including INVEST-compliant user story generation, sprint planning, backlog management, and velocity tracking. Use for story writing, sprint planning, stakeholder communication, and agile ceremonies.
skill.summary: Agile product ownership toolkit for Senior Product Owner including INVEST-compliant user story gener...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a pure Python utility script with no network access, no file system writes, no external commands, and no environment variable access. The script generates INVEST-compliant user stories and performs sprint planning calculations using hardcoded sample data. All functionality aligns with the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Writing user stories that follow INVEST criteria takes time and expertise. This tool automatically creates well-formed user stories with acceptance criteria, story point estimates, and priority assignments. Sprint capacity planning helps teams commit to achievable goals.
actual_capabilities: Generate INVEST-compliant user stories from epics
Create automatic acceptance criteria with Gherkin syntax
Estimate story complexity and assign priority levels
Plan sprints based on team capacity
Create backlog summaries with priority breakdowns
limitations: Uses sample data for demonstration; requires integration for real project data
Does not connect to project management tools like Jira or Trello
Does not track actual sprint velocity over time

use_cases.title: Write sprint-ready stories
use_cases.description: Convert feature requirements into well-structured user stories with clear acceptance criteria and estimates.

use_cases.title: Plan sprint capacity
use_cases.description: Calculate how many stories your team can commit to based on velocity and capacity constraints.

use_cases.title: Break down epics
use_cases.description: Transform large epics into manageable, independent user stories that teams can implement incrementally.

prompt_templates.title: Generate basic stories
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Agile Product Owner skill to generate INVEST-compliant user stories for this feature: [describe your feature]. Include acceptance criteria and story point estimates.

prompt_templates.title: Plan sprint
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Agile Product Owner skill to create a sprint plan with capacity of [number] points. Show committed stories and stretch goals.

prompt_templates.title: Prioritize backlog
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Agile Product Owner skill to generate stories for this epic and prioritize them: [describe epic]. Identify critical and high-priority items.

prompt_templates.title: Add technical enablers
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Agile Product Owner skill to generate user stories including technical enabler stories for: [describe requirements with technical needs like caching, APIs, infrastructure].

best_practices: Review generated stories with stakeholders to validate narrative clarity
Use sprint planning output as a starting point and adjust based on team velocity
Combine with actual project data from your issue tracker for production use
anti_patterns: Accepting story point estimates without validating against team capacity
Generating stories without reviewing acceptance criteria with developers
Using automated estimates as final values without team discussion

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Jira or Azure DevOps?
faq.answer: The skill generates stories in a standard format that can be copied into any project management tool.

faq.question: How accurate are the story point estimates?
faq.answer: Estimates follow complexity indicators but should be refined with your actual team during sprint planning.

faq.question: Can I connect this to my real backlog?
faq.answer: Currently uses sample data. Integration with external tools requires additional development.

faq.question: Does this skill store any data?
faq.answer: No. The script runs in memory and outputs results to stdout without persisting data.

faq.question: What is the INVEST criteria used?
faq.answer: INVEST stands for Independent, Negotiable, Valuable, Estimable, Small, and Testable story attributes.

faq.question: How is this different from other agile tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on generating well-formed stories with acceptance criteria directly in your workflow.
